case_vignette: A 37-year-old nulliparous woman comes to the physician because of a 6-month history of heavy, prolonged bleeding with menstruation, dyspareunia, and cyclical abdominal pain. Menses previously occurred at regular 28-day intervals and lasted 4 days with normal flow. Pelvic examination shows an asymmetrically enlarged, nodular uterus consistent in size with a 10-week gestation. A urine pregnancy test is negative. A photomicrograph of a section of an endometrial biopsy specimen is shown.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?
